newsitem.title: INDIA: Mild earthquake shakes Indian capital.
newsitem.headline: Mild earthquake shakes Indian capital.

text.p: A mild earthquake shook the Indian capital on Friday but there were no reports of casualties or damage, a seismological department official said.
He told Reuters the tremor measuring 2.5 on the Richter scale occurred at around 5.35 p.m. (1205 GMT) with its epicentre in New Delhi. He gave no other details.
On Thursday at least 38 people were killed and more than 1,000 injured in a quake that struck the central Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. It measured 6.0 on the Richter scale.
Thursday's quake's epicentre lay in the village of Kosamghat, some 750 km (460 miles) southeast of New Delhi.
In September 1993, about 10,000 people were killed in the western state of Maharashtra when an earthquake measuring 6.3 on the Richter scale struck the Latur-Osmanabad region.
Earthquakes measuring between four and five on the Richter scale are powerful enough to cause heavy damage in populated areas.
